cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. August 1942.SECRET.W.M. (42)106th Conclusions.Copy Nd.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND key it is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document war CABINET 106 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Friday, August 7, 1942, at 9-30 a.m.Present:The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Deputy Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The following were also present:The Right Hon. S. M. Bruce,Accredited Representative of theGovernment of the Commonwealthof Australia.The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the admiralty the Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.Air Chief Marshal Sir Charles F. A.Portal, Chief of the Air Staff.The Hon. W. Nash, Accredited Repre-sentative of the Government of theDominion of New Zealand.The Right Hon. Sir James Grigg,M.P., Secretary of State for War.Admiral of the Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.Lieutenant-General A. E. Nye, Vice-Chief of the Imperial General Staff.Secretariat:Sir Edward Bridges.Major-General Sir Hastings Ismay.Mr. L. F. Burgis.Contents.. minute no. - Subject.1 Middle East ........Military Appointments.2 The Royal Canadian Navy ....Sinking of U-boats.Page198[24218-1] Middle East. 1. The War Cabinet had a discussion in regard to certain high.Military military appointments in the Middle East.Appointments. The discussion and the Conclusions reached are recorded in the(Previous Secretary's Standard File of War ^Cabinet Conclusions. N 'Reference:W.M. (42) 104th _Conclusions, .Minute 2.)The Royal 2. The War Cabinet were informed that the Royal CanadianCanadian Navy. Navy had sunk another U-boat on the previous night. They hadSinking of now sunk four, or possibly five, within a few days.U-boats. The War Cabinet-Asked the First Lord of the Admiralty to send a telegram- of congratulation and good wishes on their behalf to theRoyal Canadian Navy. \Great George Street, S.W.1,August 7, 1942.
